intro: Horkelia purpurascens var. pinetorum, commonly known as the Sierra foothill horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Polemoniaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, spurred petals and blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has a low-growing habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. This variety is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and ecological adaptations to its native environment.
